thread.title: Hunter screws antlers into deer skull to claim record, website reports
thread.title_full: Hunter screws antlers into deer skull to claim record, website reports | NOLA.com

author: Todd Masson, NOLA.com | The Times-Picayune
title: Hunter screws antlers into deer skull to claim record, website reports
text:
A North Carolina hunter fooled a prominent website and an official scorer with a 208-inch non-typical buck he reported arrowing last week that has turned out to be a hoax, northcarolinasportsman.com reported Monday.
According to the website, Nick Davis of Elkin, N.C., contacted northcarolinasportsman.com on Thursday asking if the site was interested in interviewing him about the new state-record buck he had arrowed. The deer had been measured by Joey Thompson, official scorer for the N.C. Bowhunters Association, and was found to be 30 inches larger than the existing state-record archery kill.
But enforcement officers with the North Carolina Wildlife Resources Commission visited Davis Sunday, and determined that the antlers were not from the Tar Heel State. According to agents, Davis had gotten the antlers from Pennsylvania and screwed them into the skull plate of a 3-point buck he had taken in North Carolina with a rifle. Davis covered the bases of the antlers with deer hide to make the set-up look more natural, Thompson told the website.
In the original story the website wrote about the supposed state-record buck, Davis shared elaborate details about jumping the deer while weed-eating on a farm he helps manage.
"I had three more bucks as big or bigger than the ones I killed last year, and I was actually going after those deer; I didn't know this one was around until two weeks ago," he told northcarolinasportsman.com. "When I jumped him, I almost dropped the weed-eater. I've never seen anything like him before."
